alert.note: Alert for Tulare (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 15 at 12:27AM PDT until March 15 at 6:11PM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 AM PDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following counties, Fresno and Tulare. * WHEN...Until 530 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1227 AM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Visalia, Tulare, Porterville, Dinuba, Orosi, Earlimart, Lindsay, Farmersville, Exeter, Orange Cove, Woodlake, Terra Bella, Three Rivers, Ivanhoe, Strathmore, East Orosi, Cutler, East Porterville, Woodville and Poplar-Cotton Center. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
